header: Criminal Bail Application No. 1/2019 (CNR No. MHPU01­017661­2018) Rahul Sakharam Ingle Vs. State of Maharashtra (Through Ranjangaon P.S.)

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 Applicant ­ Rahul Sakharam Ingle has filed this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for the grant of Anticipatory Bail in connection with C.R.No. 217/2018 under Section 323, 326, 336, 337, 504 and 506 of the Indian Penal Code.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of the code of criminal procedure
under section 323, 326, 336, 337, 504 and 506 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: [2] Perused the application and say filed by the I.O. Heard the Ld. Counsel for the Applicant and Ld. APP for the State.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Perused the application and say filed by the I.O. Heard the Ld. Counsel for the Applicant and Ld. APP for the State.

arguments.text: [3] The prosecution case is that on 03.12.2018 at about 05.30 p.m. when the complainant Bhivram Ingle came to his house after grazing the sheep, the applicant came there and started abusing the complainant. The complainant was trying to pull down the applicant, but the applicant did not listen anything and hit the complainant with the axe on the right arm of the complainant and started threatening him. Complainant ran away and while running the applicant hit the complainant with the gilory on the left side of the forehead. Then the applicant started abusing and threatening the complainant by saying that, he will finish him. On these allegations, the applicant prosecuted.

argumentSentences.text: [3] The prosecution case is that on 03.12.2018 at about 05.30 p.m. when the complainant Bhivram Ingle came to his house after grazing the sheep, the applicant came there and started abusing the complainant.
The complainant was trying to pull down the applicant, but the applicant did not listen anything and hit the complainant with the axe on the right arm of the complainant and started threatening him.
Complainant ran away and while running the applicant hit the complainant with the gilory on the left side of the forehead.
Then the applicant started abusing and threatening the complainant by saying that, he will finish him.
On these allegations, the applicant prosecuted.

arguments.text: [4] The Ld. Counsel for Applicant stated that the applicant is innocent and has not committed any offence. There is a civil dispute on account of land in between the applicant and complainant. The injuries sustained to the complainant are simple in nature. The complainant has been discharged from the hospital on the very next date. The ingredients of Section 326 of I.P.C. is not attracted. There is delay in lodging FIR. The custodial interrogation of the applicant is not necessary. Hence, prayed to enlarge the applicant on anticipatory bail.

argumentSentences.text: [4] The Ld. Counsel for Applicant stated that the applicant is innocent and has not committed any offence.
There is a civil dispute on account of land in between the applicant and complainant.
The injuries sustained to the complainant are simple in nature.
The complainant has been discharged from the hospital on the very next date.
The ingredients of Section 326 of I.P.C. is not attracted.
There is delay in lodging FIR.
The custodial interrogation of the applicant is not necessary.
Hence, prayed to enlarge the applicant on anticipatory bail.

arguments.text: [5] The Ld. APP for the State submitted that, there is prima facie accusation against the applicant/accused. The grievous injury sustained to the complainant. The police want to seize axe and gilory from the applicant/accused. Considering the gravity of the offence, he prayed to reject the application.

argumentSentences.text: [5] The Ld. APP for the State submitted that, there is prima facie accusation against the applicant/accused.
The grievous injury sustained to the complainant.
The police want to seize axe and gilory from the applicant/accused.
Considering the gravity of the offence, he prayed to reject the application.

arguments.text: [6] After hearing the submissions of both the sides, it reveals that, the complainant sustained grievous injury. The I.O. want to seize axe and gilory from the applicant/accused. The allegations against the applicant are serious. The offence u/s. 326 of IPC is punishable with imprisonment up to 10 years. Looking to the gravity of the offence, and nature of injury sustained to the complainant,it is not desirable to grant anticipatory bail. His custodial interrogation is necessary for the purpose of fair investigation. Hence, following order :­

The I.O. want to seize axe and gilory from the applicant/accused.
The allegations against the applicant are serious.

Looking to the gravity of the offence, and nature of injury sustained to the complainant,it is not desirable to grant anticipatory bail.
His custodial interrogation is necessary for the purpose of fair investigation.
Hence, following order :­

processedText:
Criminal Bail Application No. 1/2019 (CNR No. MHPU01­017661­2018) Rahul Sakharam Ingle Vs. State of Maharashtra (Through Ranjangaon P.S.) 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 Applicant ­ Rahul Sakharam Ingle has filed this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for the grant of Anticipatory Bail in connection with C.R.No. 217/2018 under Section 323, 326, 336, 337, 504 and 506 of the Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
[2] Perused the application and say filed by the I.O. Heard the Ld. Counsel for the Applicant and Ld. APP for the State. 
---argument-ends---
[3] The prosecution case is that on 03.12.2018 at about 05.30 p.m. when the complainant Bhivram Ingle came to his house after grazing the sheep, the applicant came there and started abusing the complainant. The complainant was trying to pull down the applicant, but the applicant did not listen anything and hit the complainant with the axe on the right arm of the complainant and started threatening him. Complainant ran away and while running the applicant hit the complainant with the gilory on the left side of the forehead. Then the applicant started abusing and threatening the complainant by saying that, he will finish him. On these allegations, the applicant prosecuted. 
---argument-ends---
[4] The Ld. Counsel for Applicant stated that the applicant is innocent and has not committed any offence. There is a civil dispute on account of land in between the applicant and complainant. The injuries sustained to the complainant are simple in nature. The complainant has been discharged from the hospital on the very next date. The ingredients of Section 326 of I.P.C. is not attracted. There is delay in lodging FIR. The custodial interrogation of the applicant is not necessary. Hence, prayed to enlarge the applicant on anticipatory bail. 
---argument-ends---
[5] The Ld. APP for the State submitted that, there is prima facie accusation against the applicant/accused. The grievous injury sustained to the complainant. The police want to seize axe and gilory from the applicant/accused. Considering the gravity of the offence, he prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
[6] After hearing the submissions of both the sides, it reveals that, the complainant sustained grievous injury. The I.O. want to seize axe and gilory from the applicant/accused. The allegations against the applicant are serious. The offence u/s. 326 of IPC is punishable with imprisonment up to 10 years. Looking to the gravity of the offence, and nature of injury sustained to the complainant,it is not desirable to grant anticipatory bail. His custodial interrogation is necessary for the purpose of fair investigation. Hence, following order :­ 
---argument-ends---
ORDER Application (Exh.1) is rejected. 
---order-ends---
Sd/­ Pune ( G.P.Agrawal ) Date : 07/01/2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. CERTIFICATE I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno : Smt. S.N.Kale Name of Court : G.P.Agrawal Addl. Sessions Judge,Pune. Order delivered on : 07/01/2019 Order signed on : 07/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 07/01/2019
